column1: Image:J.R.R. Tolkien - Bilbo comes to the Huts of the Raft-elves (I).jpg - Bilbo comes to the Huts of the Raft-elves
The huts of the raft-elves referred to a village used by the raft-elves
column2: that was to be found on a protruding bank of the Forest River
column3: close to the eastern edge of the forest of Mirkwood.J.R.R. Tolkien
column4: ":File:J.R.R. Tolkien - Bilbo comes to the Huts of the Raft-elves (I).jpg"
column5: :File:J.R.R. Tolkien - Bilbo comes to the Huts of the Raft-elves (II).jpg
column6: pp. 128-31 It is stated that the subjects of Thranduil "had houses or huts on the ground and in the branches"
column7: so it is possible that these huts were situated within the Woodland Realm.

column1: The raft-elves collected empty barrels from the Elvenkings Halls in this village
column2: brought by the current of the Forest River. The barrels were then tied together and left to float to Lake-town (from where barrels filled with goods had originally been brought up the river to the Woodland Realm).

column3: spent a night hiding outside the village of the raft-elves while pursuing Thorin and Company (who were escaping the imprisonment of the Elves of Mirkwood inside empty barrels).

column1: : The Raft-elves reside in the village of Celebannon
column2: which consists of a dozen houses.
